page.title: 02Farming. Kingswood District
page.content: Most of the{farmland}in the Kingswood District area is{intensively {managed grassland.}In recent years the farms have changed from dairying to {mixed farming.}Farmers now rear beef cattle, stable and livery horses and keep chickens,sheep or goats. A typical farm, called{Moundscourt {Farm,}has been occupied by the same farmer for thirty years. The land is recorded in the first Domesday Book. The farm has twenty calves and stables for twenty horses. It is a family business employing casual labour for hay making in the summer. 14 of the 36 acres are used for grazing and 22 acres for grass to feed to the{livestock} in winter. There are two tractors,four bale trailers and one hay bob.The{cattle}are Herefords crossed with Friesians and usually reared on the farm.
